properties.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 8:09PM MST until February 5 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW ALONG WITH EXTREME WINDCHILLS
POSSIBLE TONIGHT ACROSS THE WIND PRONE AREAS OF INTERSTATE 80
WITH HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW LATER IN THE WEEK...

* WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow expected with bitter cold
wind chills. Sustained winds between 25 to 35 mph with winds
gusting as high as 55 mph.

* WHERE...Northern Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington,
and the southern Laramie Range, including the Interstate 80
Summit.

* WHEN...From 2 AM to 1 PM MST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility
between one half mile to one mile at times. Slick and icy
roads are expected due to drifting snow. Travel will also be
hazardous to light and high profile vehicles with winds
gusting around 55 mph at times. The hazardous conditions could
impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Bitter cold wind chills as low as 25
below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little
as 15 minutes.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas.

A Winter Weather Advisory for blowing snow means that
visibilities will be limited due to strong winds blowing snow
around. Use caution when traveling...especially in open areas.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 1 PM MST WEDNESDAY
